title: Cannot Play Movies on Amazon (Prime) at HD resolution (6GB) with version 130.0 Firefox
content:
This is a continuing problem that showed up on version 127, maybe 128, and continued through 129, and now to 130.0.

Attempts using Firefox to play movies at HD (highest 6GB data resolution) fail. Using, for example, the Edge browser works fine. This problem showed up as noted in the first sentence of this post. Manually changing an obscure "about:config" variable from 1 to 0 did not fix the problem.

I just updated to 130.0, immediately tried to play a movie at highest resolution, it failed. Changed the obscure variable from the value it had, 0, to 1 and it failed still. Changed it back to 0 and it failed.
creator: alternateruss

title: How to chose from multiple saved accounts and passwords for basic auth?
content:
I have my webserver "example.com" configured to ask for basic auth credentials on different paths, like "example.com/siteA" and "example.com/siteB". Login and username are different for "siteA" and "siteB".

Firefox will gladly save both sets of username and password when I type them in and login, but unlike with website login forms like Wordpress, there is no built-in way to select an account in this "native" login popup (see attached screenshot).

I could not find a way to edit my stored passwords to distinguish by path, it only stores the host/domain name "example.com".

Is there something I missed or is this currently not supported?

Does anyone have any thoughts please?

title: Firefox hangs on Wordpress Login
content:
I am using FF 129.0 64 bit on Linux Mint. AFAIK all is up to the latest version.

When I log into my website admin on wordpress, my site gets redirected for a security check on the server (lightspeed or PC Guard). Once this is complete, the login continues.

Unfortunately for the last 6 weeks, my website redirects with a message, "Verifying that you are not a robot" and it hangs there permanently.

I have tried to get my server to disconnest Lightspeed and PC Guard (but then have NO security protection). Nothing seemed to work, and access was sproradic, but seemed best when FF was completely cleaned, cache, cookies, etc. However, even this did not guarantee a login.

Then I found that all worked perfectly using Chrome. Further, having logged in using Chrome, the FF version would now be unlocked and work perfectly.

So it seems as though FF is not clearing a status/flag/file somewhere and that Chrome clears this, leaving FF working again - for another 24 hours. Then the whole cycle starts again.

Any ideas?

Mark
creator: mark_holtom

title: Google docs problem, happening only in Firefox
content:
I have a google docs problem, only in Firefox! Doesn't happen in Chrome. Problem is I can't get bullets in lists.

      • My configuration

Macbook Air M2, 2022 MacOS Sonoma 14.6.1 Firefox 129.0.2

      • What I have tried

I searched reddit/r/googledocs. Tried everything they suggested.

I cleared Firefox cache and cookies and site settings, then shut down my mac and restarted. problem continues.

      • The problem, in detail 
   Select a paragraph 
   Go to Format / Bullets and numbering / Bulleted list menu, like I'm supposed to 
   Select a menu option (round bullets, arrows, stars, etc)

Every option works except the one I want - bullets! When I select arrows, I get arrows. Yay. When I select stars I get stars. Yay again. But when I select bullets I get little boxes, not bullets.

      • Any suggestions? thanks!

title: Is "Resend" broken in Network pane or it's just me?
content:
I'm using Firefox in Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (snap version, so it's updated regularly) and I've been having this issue for months. I use Network pane heavily as aid to develop the backend portion of a web site with a JSON based API. Now and then I need to repeat an HTTP request, so I use the "Resend" option, and everything's fine except I'm unable to see the server response. "Size" column shows "0 B" and "Response" tab is empty. I'm positively sure the server cannot distinguish whether it's a brand new or resent request and does not send empty responses. It's something specific to XHR requests, regular requests are not affected. Troubleshoot Mode doesn't make any difference.

Is this a known issue or something that only happens to me?

title: Enhanced Tracking Protection in Incognito windows blocking OneTrust
content:
Hello,

While working with sign-up web forms integrated with a OneTrust external web form collection point via its SDK, we've observed that Mozilla Firefox's Enhanced Tracking Protection, when set to its default settings, blocks requests to OneTrust URLs (e.g. https://privacyportalde-cdn.onetrust.com).

Is there any way to ensure that incognito windows can correctly communicate with OneTrust without requiring action from the end user? Additionally, knowing the reasons why Mozilla is blocking these requests to OneTrust would be helpful for troubleshooting this issue.

Thank you
creator: adegano1

title: Need Feedback: My Car Rental Website Issues on Firefox?
content:
'Hi everyone,

I hope you’re doing well!

I’m reaching out because we’ve encountered some issues with our car rental website,https://sandiegocarservice.com, specifically when using Firefox. While the site seems to be working fine on other browsers, we’ve noticed some inconsistencies and potential bugs on Firefox.

If you’re using Firefox and have a moment, I would greatly appreciate your help in testing the site. Here are a few things to look out for:

Page Load Time: Are there any delays or issues with loading pages? Functionality: Do all features (like booking forms and search filters) work as expected? Visual Issues: Are there any display problems or layout inconsistencies? Your feedback will be invaluable in helping us improve the site for all users. Please let us know if you encounter any problems or if everything seems to be working fine.

Thanks in advance for your help! Best regards, [LEE JHON]
creator: leejhon0010
